items.sentence: Tom told me that he intended to go to Boston with Mary.
Tom took something from his pocket and gave it to Mary.
Tom used to have posters of rock musicians on his wall.
We probably should\'ve applied for a visa much earlier.
We should tell Tom that Mary doesn\'t want him to come.
We shouldn\'t have to be dealing with this problem now.
I don\'t think Tom will ever forgive me for doing that.
I don\'t want to discourage you from trying to do that.
I know that it\'s highly unlikely that anyone knows me.
Tom finally talked Mary into lending him her accordion.
Tom noticed that Mary wasn\'t wearing her wedding ring.
Tom didn\'t know Mary didn\'t know how to speak French.
Did you remember that you were supposed to buy candles?
The mayor said that lawbreakers wouldn\'t be tolerated.
Tom asked Mary if she had enjoyed herself at the party.
Were you able to swim when you were thirteen years old?
If there\'s nothing else for me to do, I\'m going home.
I doubt that Tom understands what we\'re talking about.
I didn\'t realize you didn\'t know how to speak French.
Tom tried his best to get here, but he didn\'t make it.
